title: [K-12] Teacher Facilitation Competency Enhancement Program for Inquiry-Based Language Learning (IBL): Integrated Text and Speech Analysis Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language instruction experience, understanding of Inquiry-Based Learning (IBL) concepts, foundational knowledge of learner language development stages, and experience using digital text analysis tools
context.additional_context: A language learning environment using digital devices (tablets/laptops) and speech recognition software. Emphasizes real-time learner-teacher interaction (writing feedback, oral presentation evaluation, pronunciation correction). Integrates text analysis tools (lexical frequency analysis, grammar error detection) with speech recognition software (pronunciation assessment, fluency measurement).

learning_goals: When designing IBL lessons, learners can establish plans to use text/speech analysis tools that predict learners’ language inquiry pathways (reading, writing, speaking, listening).

Learners can execute ≥3 strategies for flexible language class adjustments via real-time learning data monitoring (e.g., vocabulary expansion, grammatical feedback, expression diversification, pronunciation correction).

When designing IBL activities, learners achieve ≥80% on assessments evaluating their ability to map language learning objectives (grammatical accuracy, lexical diversity, text comprehension, discourse competence) to analytical metrics.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
